source.title: Default network activity, coupled with the frontoparietal control network, supports goal-directed cognition

confidence_rationale: Strong boundary evidence that DMN can couple with control systems during goal-directed tasks, limiting strict non-action isolation claims.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Default network and frontoparietal control network can cooperate during goal-directed cognition.
mapping.ree_translation: Mixed for MECH-029: reflective-mode processes can be co-opted in goal-directed control, so separation should be gated rather than absolute.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Coupling patterns vary by task and do not imply removal of commitment-boundary safeguards.
mapping.source_context: Meta-analytic/functional evidence for DMN-control coupling in goal-directed cognition.

confidence_components.notes: Critical mixed evidence against overly rigid reflective-lane isolation.
